meanings.definition: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically in a way that is based on practical rather than theoretical considerations.
meanings.sent1: She took a pragmatical approach to solving the problem, focusing on what could be done practically.
meanings.sent2: In her pragmatical view, it was better to fix the leaky roof than to dream of a perfect house.
meanings.sent3: His pragmatical decision to bring an umbrella on a sunny day made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The pragmatical choice of using a map instead of relying on instincts saved them from getting lost.
meanings.sent5: The pragmatical advice to start small and grow gradually stuck with her throughout her career.

meanings.definition: Relating to or concerned with the affairs of everyday life.
meanings.sent1: The pragmatical concerns of budgeting and grocery shopping occupied her mind daily.
meanings.sent2: His pragmatical approach to household chores made him a reliable partner.
meanings.sent3: The pragmatical decision to wear sneakers to a fancy dinner party raised a few eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: Her pragmatical view of life as a series of daily tasks to be completed kept her grounded.
meanings.sent5: The pragmatical choice to take public transportation instead of driving saved money and reduced stress.

meanings.definition: Practical or realistic rather than idealistic.
meanings.sent1: The pragmatical solution to the budget issue involved cutting unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent2: His pragmatical outlook on relationships focused on communication and compromise.
meanings.sent3: The pragmatical idea of a self-cleaning house seemed like a dream come true.
meanings.sent4: Choosing the pragmatical path of hard work over luck led to his success.
meanings.sent5: The pragmatical approach of setting achievable goals helped her progress steadily in her career.
